bow: mothers of reddit what do you wish you were told what do you wish you had gift type of support etc going into giving your first birth mothers of reddit my sister who is basically half mother to me she is the best is due in one month she has been reading up on lot of books to get ready but is still pretty nervous about the actual giving birth process was hoping could do something for her or get something for her to make that process as painless but still memorable in good way as possible being guy myself and quite inexperienced am turning to you all for your advice what would you have like to have been told or what would you like to have had going into your first time giving birth thank you edit did receive any responses on askreddit so trying more specific subreddit would really appreciate any advice or suggestion second edit thank you all so much for each and every post bit shocked that it sounds like it hurts lot more than people make it sound because honestly it sounds like lot of people keep telling her it wo be as bad as people say so it seems like the opposite is kind of true learning lot about small things like padcicles and all the little extras you can do to make things more comfortable will take the time over the coming days to respond to everyones thoughtful advice and comments so apologies if you do get response right away ve been checking them on the comments in my spare time on my phone and the overwhelming number of comments and replies ve received so far is really wonderful thank you all so much been told yeah your tailbone might break or less of the sugar coating and more hard realities about labour and birth to have seriously buy her really good lip chap out of all the stuff packed in the hospital bag it was the only thing used your lips get so chapped has she come across the word transition to describe phase of labor it comes just before pushing and it feels like you re dying at least it did for me very very painful it made me panic and wish that someone in the room had used that word transition ended up with an emergency section because begged for last minute epidural during the painful part you have to sit perfectly still when the needle goes in and sadly felt my first urge to push as was sitting there about to receive the injection essentially made it past the hardest part and gave up too soon the medicine threw my body off and lost the urge to push do know how you personally can make use of this advice except to pass it on to the mom to be and suggest that she put clear instructions in her birth plan requesting that nurses and her support network use the word transition to explain to her what she going through if and when she starts to panic often wonder if have been able to summon more strength is somebody had something more meaningful to me than just breathe also if anyone in the delivery room is going to be uncomfortable seeing her screaming and cussing and begging for relief do have them there in the first place my mom cowered in the corner because she never seen her brace daughter reduced to such state and it really did help the vibe that people were so worried for me the nurses and doctors will know if something is actually wrong so do let the woman giving birth freak you out if she seems like she not gon na make it try to beat in mind that the birthing process is disorienting for her when it gets heavy what she needs are calm confident people who know what she knows about giving birth people who read the same books prepared with the same classes and can use language that will be buried in the back of her head when she needs someone to get through to her that this too shall pass and everything is going well the birth will come and go quickly found the things needed were things for afterwards really liked comfortable robe with pockets that wore lot in the first weeks especially if she is planning on nursing or drop off few freezer meals or meals in the week after the baby is born since she will be in sleep deprived haze for the baby have little clay hand prints from both my kids that treasure the baby will grow so fast it reminder how tiny they were or for something less personal but just as appreciated by her gift card for newborn photo shoot with photographer it is always welcome gift if you do this tell the photog when the baby is due and remind your sister to book shortly after the baby is born good luck have her come here even if it just lurking this is one of the best places to be as well as babybumps that being said let her know that every mother is different and so is every baby nothing is like it is in the movies or books make sure she takes care of herself so she can take care of baby too if you want to help her go by her house and make dinner or bring food one of the things wish was that the only thing had to worry about was me and my baby not laundry or dishes you will never be the same person again it will be exhausting and probably the most painful experience of your life but it will be totally worth it bake her oatmeal cookies for post birth found good oatmeal chocolate chip cookie was the perfect thing to eat one handed while nursing because was so hungry while nursing this having portable one handed thing to eat at home in the early weeks helped me so much more than thought it would cookies are good idea before my baby came spent some time preparing some frozen breakfast burritos they lasted me about two months and was eating them lot because of how hungry nursing made me heat it up minutes in the microwave instant healthy food packed it with veggies and eggs and used whole wheat tortillas so didnt feel guilty eating them it was amazing told no matter what your plan is how prepared you are birth will never be what you expect it do stress to much about knowing what it will be like and just lean into the lack of control more practically wish had been told could call in for sleeping pill had contractions straight for days and therefore did not sleep for days straight prior to going into labor not good way to start things off had actually did this got pedicure right around the due date it cheered me up to look at my toes looking pretty during the beginning of labor when things were less intense wish someone would have been on call to bring me delicious food after birth was starving both times and the hospital only had shitty snacks because delivered outside of cafeteria hours other things liked in the hospital pillow from home slippers comfy jammy pants google search how to make padcicles if she delivers vaginally it feels like you ve been punched 400 times in the vag for at least week and more if you ve got stitches yikes offer to come do *set list of approved tasks* regularly like bring an easy meal do the dishes wash fold laundry if that is okay with her hold baby while she showers naps she needs tucks pads they are great for the downtown area after baby and ridiculously large maxi pads plain soft cotton undies she wo care about dumping ruining remind her everything in the room is hers those bed pads in particular were indispensable in fact my two are and and we still use the bed pads as drop cloths potty training anything protectors and when they were slugs as tummy time and nakey time mats sponge bath mats leaky boob bed protectors lochia insurance covers changing mats the book eat sleep poop is really factual and has great symptom checker and medication dose chart no one really tells you much things wish had chopstick my favorite drink for after even if it just tea or soda my own pillow from home warm socks and robe help that first week or so is nice dinner for the new mom and dad even if you only stop by for 30 minutes or an hour that ll give her break to shower or eat honestly that after the entire event did give flying crap what had happened had my baby actually forgot lot of the details of my labor and had to be told about most of it the moment saw her started crying like well baby after that did remember much seriously once had her *nothing else mattered* do remember what had been afraid of beforehand do remember if any of it happened just remember seeing my little girl later though was told that pooped on my mom so there that what wish someone had told me parents have been screwing up for centuries you ll make mistakes and it ll be just fine kids are insanely resilient and will love you all the same took birth class before had my little girl only weeks ago so it still pretty fresh on my mind probably one of the most helpful things learned was to move around change positions throughout labor in fact going on short walk with my husband was what really helped me go from early to active labor as far as getting her something during the actual labor birth guess two things that really helped me were birthing ball many places may already have them available and warm rice sock that my husband held against my lower back granted did have back labor but it might still be helpful and relaxing regardless after the birth one thing ve relied on lot is the book caring for your baby and young child it helped put my mind at ease with everything going on with the baby whether it cluster feeding birth marks or even the color of her poo good luck to your sister found birth to be very intense experience but not scary like had previously thought it would be and it so incredibly rewarding removed okay so we went to the birthing classes and learned all about what it would be like how it starts slow how to breathe through it and everything and my labor started hard and fast with contractions less than min apart my baby was born in hours wish someone had told me that every birth is different so you really ca know what to expect kept thinking this is it this is anything like they explained but also not to panic because your body knows what it doing and that the pain is scary but it feels so purposeful and encouragement just you can do it would be helpful when checked in the first thing the nurse did after getting us in our room was hand us menu and called the cafeteria to place our order since she knew they be closed by the time gave birth was very thankful for that our room had mini fridge too so we kept the food in there until needed yes was going to mention chapstick my lips got so dry they cracked right down the middle had to ask family member to bring me chapstick and throat lozenges all that heavy breathing will take toll unless you have mercifully quick labor go with the flow let go of expectations and plans bring socks and stretchy clothes and white noise machine when got home from the hospital woman from my church came over and deep cleaned our kitchen and bathroom am incredibly thankful for this even year later would your sister be interested in tens unit had one for my labor and it definitely helped take the edge off for while nursing pillow for at the hospital whether she bottle feeds or nurses it will save her sore back also an extra pillow from home to sit on in the hospital bed where the bed goes up and down the mattress is thinner it also happens to be where moms poor abused tailbone will be towel from home the hospital ones are horrible just all the soft comfy things really heck smuggle in kitten food that can be microwaved and does not make dirty dishes cleaning going to the grocery store laundry so wish had found the budget for cleaners it hard to budget for but would have been so so nice if could have someone come and clean even if it was my whole house just the kitchen and the bathroom besides that loved freezer meals or freshly cut fruit this is helpful luckily people were telling me about transitioning when it became obvious that was willing to get the cervix checked 15 min after having the doctor last check me it was incredibly uncomfortable to be checked because was laboring sitting up and had to lay down and then the pressure when asked to be checked they knew it was transition and went from to 10 in about 15 minutes after had an emergency section the things used the most were huge cup with lid for ice water coconut oil for my nips and the baby skin lightweight long sleeve wrap robe thing and that all can think of for now to be honest the only things that used during labor were chapstick and slippers could have cared less about anything else honestly needed more support after seriously though on the chapstick there is reason everyone on here is saying that have you thought of making welcome baby basket or welcome baby diaper bag would put items in for mom and baby if had ton of money this would be what would include as they are items found the most helpful in the days following the birth halo snuza go or other such movement\ breathing monitor this eased my fear of sids not entirely but when your exhausted and hormonal that extra safeguard helps people do seem to know about these it is my number one suggestion bamboo nursing pads and avent breast shells when milk comes in and you are new to breastfeeding nipples get sore the breast shells keep clothing from rubbing on sore nipples then when they get tougher the bamboo ones are soft and comfortable mothers milk tea traditional medicines and yogi both make good ones prefer the yogi as it tastes like chamomile everyone forgets to get something for the mom got necklace with the birth month stone and cute comfy socks ca really wear the necklace yet due to breastfeeding but love it chocolate and other snacks esp if breastfeeding it makes you hungry lansinoh it lanolin and is awesome for sore nipples white noise maker there are lots of different kinds have skip hop moonlight melodies owl love it it has nightlight that is awesome for night feedings baby books also some for her even puzzle books like sudoku in the middle of cluster feed session so literally stuck on the couch for hours or net flix subscription pretty much this would be 200 plus basket but you could pick one main item and some lesser ones definitely agree with hiring cleaning service for bit some nice things really liked were the three piece nursing host and cute hospital bag it was nice to have something pretty and have used it lot since aw that great that your nurse planned ahead for it my baby was born at 9:20 pm and we did get to our recovery room until 1:15 am and had eaten in over 30 hours my nurse smuggled me turkey sandwich and little dixie cup of chocolate ice cream from the nurse lounge she was saint was craving ice cream so badly while in labor food bring her or get delivered food thinking about cooking for yourself is the worst if your water breaks and it is *slow leak* shower and eat first the doctor insisted go straight to the hospital which makes sense but was having contractions once there could shower nor eat anything but popsicles went in at am and did deliver until after 10 pm was soooo hungry all day makes for crappy labor removed wish had been more up front about my needs and wants for myself and my daughter wish my husband had been less of pushover too my birth experience was pretty bad nearly had seizure from being reclined too far baby smothering my vena cava during cervix checks and ended up with an emergency caesarean which was an hour late for was denied pain medication until went back for the procedure and thus had foley catheter inserted with no lubricant nor pain medication still ca pee right afterwards the nurses were rude and demanding and at one point my baby was not brought back to me for two hours after asked for her had her sent to the nursery to get some sleep was lectured and my baby was pinched yes pinched by nurse was also denied extra diapers when she had run out and was forced to walk out of the hospital instead of the customary wheelchair please please please be an advocate for your sister and help her stand up for herself after she gives birth wish someone had told me that my cervix would refuse to dilate until my water broke that would have saved me lot of time and pain agree with the top comment though the birth is not the issue even though it exciting and scary it over quickly this is exactly what got on here to write also delivered after the cafeteria was closed and after not eating all day was starving still ca believe they do have options for that bring snacks if you know you wo have someone to bring you food pillows and good filling junk food was starving after delivery all wanted was hamburger but the hospital were pretty shitty would ve killed for some jack in the box things you could give her after baby is born food snacks warm meals etc anything so she does have to think about feeding herself because she will be too tired to cook or grocery shop comfy clothes robes nursing tanks comfy loose pants time for her to take nap come over to the house load the baby into stroller and go for little walk or something so she can rest for minute even if you just walk up and down the sidewalk on her street for 30 minutes that would be helpful the key is to remove the baby for little bit as mom you just ca get good sleep with the baby in your vicinity instincts and whatnot time to run an errand out of the house if needed offer to sit with the baby so she can run to the store for little bit or something along those lines if she needs to get out help during outings if she needs to go somewhere and has to bring the baby offer to accompany her as an extra set of hands post baby food and more food bonus if it homemade or something other than frozen pizza or fast food go to her house and clean the kitchen and do the dishes or go over few days after she home and bring food and clean something do that every week and you ll be the best bro ham uncle ever removed wow 30 hours is long time with no food that was nice of your nurse my labor was only 24 hours half of which was at the hospital everything was done in one room so no having to move for recovery definitely recommend doing maternity ward tour before the birth for anyone new to the hospital that way you know what to expect what to bring and the tour guide can answer any questions you may have yes yes yes to the towel read that on people hospital bag lists and sort of rolled my eyes but after my first post birth shower it was like drying off with piece of paper towel next time will definitely bring my own towel removed think taking some kind of childbirth class is crucial at least 12 hours worth lamaze is great option did hypnobabies and had beautiful pain free unmedicated birth with 10 lbs baby it was hard work but felt super empowered by the whole experience books are okay but class can give you demos and hands on practice also get her doula if she does have one all the research indicates that mothers report experiencing less pain fewer interventions and better outcomes when they have doula though the birth is just the beginning it is big deal to lot of women and can be traumatic without good support it can also be transformative and empowering and an amazing bonding experience for mama baby and partner **mouseover** or **click** to view the metric conversion for this comment http fiddle jshell net convertstometric xhk4y5h5 show light 10 20lbs 20= 204 20kg 0a 10 lbs kg post feedback in tometric gt it feels like you ve been punched 400 times in the vag for at least week and more if you ve got stitches yikes it amazes me how many people genuinely believe that childbirth is only one day of pain and then it all over amp it only positive feelings and joy like it just astounding that people can really believe that you can have *7 pound human being rip its way out of bodily orifice* and then be in absolutely no pain after removed also read about toilet paper the hospital ones are thin and scratchy honestly it jerks like me that spread that sort of nonsense come from long line of easy birthers both of my kiddos were small five and six pounds and had really easy labors both times stopped taking advil after day if was on the internet reading horror stories might have believed that all women have it so easy mine was not over quickly please tell me am not the only one the first poop no the first week of poops 21 and 24 hours of hospital labor respectively here but in the grand scheme of things one miserable day is short compared with weeks of healing months of recovery and year of infancy removed lactation consultant good one gift certificate would be awesome if she wanted to breastfeed or doula for the birth or even just photographer for the birth would have loved after maid service or meal service or netflix found most people told me about labor but not how common it is to end up getting section to not be afraid to say no to visitors in the following days post birth be prepared that once that baby leaves your body it totally not about you anymore was in lot of pain and no one really cared lol it was kind of weird if you have to use formula get those formula dispensers and fill about at night with pre filled bottles of water on the night stand so mixing bottle is super easy it took us way to long to figure that one out if her support person is apt to giving back massages then some relaxing massage oil did bring oils but my husband and midwife god bless her rubbed my back while contractions were setting in until my epidural had back labour and decided on pain relief thinking go in without anything to be honest did feel like needed much at the hospital other than maybe comfy but not overly hot robe and maybe slippers used the hospital gown and was pretty much half naked most of the time while too tired to care but to echo previous posters frozen meals as she will be too tired to cook most likely bran muffins seriously or gift for home cleaning service because we ai got no time for that also enjoyed soaking in the tub with bath bombs etc once my stitches healed 3rd degree that little bugger so she may enjoy that too 19 hours of labor hours of pushing then section it was rough to say the least do ask just do it post baby kept refusing help saying fine we re good it going great but come midnight it did feel that way show up and fold some laundry while you talk wash the dishes while you chat just show up with fav lunch or dinner just do it that the best help new mom needs buy large comfy granny panties and very thick period pads it was insane how much bled over weeks first time tore pretty bad upwards fuck that second time it was the nursing cramps did tear that time and hear the uterus shrinking is more painful with subsequent births have to agree both healing experiences were totally different for me this someone warned me and told me to take stool softener beforehand but forgot about it nearly cried during the first poop even after holding it for several days until it nearly fell out if it hurts like your pubic bones are literally scraping together or your about to split in half after any pain meds wear off ot whatevs that might be more than just normal birth pain and actually be symphysis pubis dysfunction basically never be afraid to ask if the pain you are in after is odd or too much went hours with nurse belittling me before someone actually realized was in so much pain my teeth were chattering just thought it was yes this set up time you come each day or each week and be there in the beginning you can feel like super woman hormones are powerful then you crash knowing someone would be there at or whatever would have been awesome and make it such that you will come and hold the baby so mom can nap or do chores or cook meal there is so much to do and shockingly little time for nursing mom work out list before baby comes then after baby ask if you can take the baby if not just work that list do ask her to make decisions just do you are awesome told let the baby stay in the nursery and you sleep had hair ties nobody tells you about silent labour you wo necessarily know you re in labour also wish had brought portable battery for charging my phone there were any free outlets available in my room portable phone battery should be in every maternity bag list scary birth and pregnancy stories just made me anxious so would recommend going through every scenario but do recommend reading up on what may happen from an objective source things wish had been told write birth plan but know it may not happen that way the most important part of my second birth plan was the bit wrote about being told of possible interventions that might be needed how much of chance there was of needing them being given all the options and time to weigh them and make decision during the birth of my first felt that the midwives were worried about being supportive rather than informative while suggesting options for medicated birth instead of giving me all of the options the birth plan is there to communicate with the birthing professionals who may not know you personally how you deal with stress what you need to cope etc would recommend writing it with that in mind instead of writing only what your perfect birth experience would be which is what wrote the first time because the moment you diverge from that plan it becomes useless keep moving during the first stage of labour lying down sitting back make the pain worse in my experience and puts the baby in more unfavorable position for birth sitting on birthing ball is good if it the correct height the one in my room was slightly too low for me so sat on stool or walked somebody explained about transition the moment told the midwife wanted drugs and could do it she said that she knew was about to do it because had just said that and then did it and it was the biggest relief ve ever felt wish someone had told me about emphasised cluster feeding the first night was home with my first baby day of his life he wanted to breastfeed nonstop was going crazy from lack of sleep and called the midwives at the hospital thinking something was wrong they told me it was normal he was helping establish my milk supply and that it would pass soon talk to breastfeeding advisor even if things are going well they can give you valuable tips and correct slight mistakes things found useful to have at the birthing centre pregnancy bra top in which to give birth comfortable modest one that looked like sports bra but much softer took the black one because wanted pool birth and it would look transparent shampoo etc for nice shower after the birth both times gave birth the first shower afterwards was heaven took towel like people recommend but ended up using the hospital birth centre because blood flip flops knew they kept the place warm so proper slippers would be needed and you do have to bend down to put on flip flops portable phone battery extra extra sets of baby clothes my second had meconium poo explosions on our only night at the birth centre and so used up all sets of clothes before my husband could come back the next morning dress suitable for breastfeeding for the first day it one piece and comfortable helpful things for when she back home help with household chores laundry cleaning vacuuming cooking doing the dishes walking the dog hold the baby while she showers bring easy to eat food anything she can eat with one hand or just fork make sure it is filling husband and once took some friends homemade lasagna which was very appreciated breastfeeding pillow also useful for bottle feeding and water bottle one of the best reminders continually tell myself my baby is now she will never stop making mistakes and it is benificial for your niece nephew to see mommy make mistakes mommy can be happy and nowhere close to perfect it is quite the important lesson so the guilt have is more of dull ache now than that all encompassing stuff when my kid was newborn also food if you are up to it never stop bringing food when you come over to visit the first month or two ate lot of takeout the first four or five months my husband ordered pizza to the hospital while was in labour lol after vomiting everything eaten the day before and enduring 25 hour labour with no food pizza in the recovery room was pretty awesome otherwise absolutely recommend helping her prepare freezer meals or bringing meal when you visit after the baby is born we did prepare any and really ate like crap for the first few weeks other than the odd time someone brought something by wish had nice electric breast pump it would have been worth the fee to rent it think just had manual hand pump which took ages to fill one bottle lansinoh would be high on my list had no idea nipples could crack and bleed that stuff was my best friend really lol yes food after delivered my daughter my sister came by and brought me an amazing ham and cheese sub was starving and it was amazing my brother in law went out at 11:00 the night delivered delivered 9:59 and brought me back wendys had been in labor since 7:00 that morning to this day that is the best burger amp fries have ever had robe is must bought navy one in case of stains and it like shirt material but thicker so it covered me without making me too hot stayed in it my two days in the hospital after delivery and 9m later wear it constantly still and the belt is attached so you ca lose it got it at motherhood maternity worth every penny no idea why you ca buy robe like this anywhere but all ve seen are the fluffy ones that would smother me and baby yep started stool softener the morning after delivered proud to say though sure it partly luck that poop was non issue for me managed little happy dance when it required no sweating or tears yes so glad brought my dark towel that first pp shower was so glorious tried so hard with my first to have natural birth with no epidural will sum it up by saying that had an incredibly long labor and ended up getting it anyways completely exhausted then had five day stay in the hospital with my jaundiced newborn where barely slept talked to my friend who had similar experience with her first drug free attempt that ended in section and told me how with her second she got the epidural right away and spent her whole labor reading and chatting on the phone and how much more she enjoyed it it made me wonder why had felt so much pressure to go without an epidural in the first place so for number two got one as soon as possible and slept through as much of it as was able so did have to start of having newborn by missing good night sleep woke up and they told me it was time and was like already had to stay for jaundice with that baby too and it was so much more enjoyable to have new baby when was physically exhausted before they even came out there is lot of great advice on here that agree with and wo take up the space to repeat just wanted to add to the conversation that there can be an awful undercurrent of competition for new parents epidural vs med free breast vs bottle baby wear vs stroller cosleep vs own room cry it out vs attachment and so on and often each side will make out like they re better than the other it helps to be reminded that the most important thing is finding out what works best for your family so everyone can be happy and healthy that not really something you can get someone but unwavering support and good perspective go long way feel like had zero surprises for labor and our first few days home because read dozens of birth stories and coming home stories of course had what thought was super easy birth with epidural and chill baby but little things like small amounts of blood in the first couple of poops swaddling techniques having one handed snacks on hand could say to myself just what baby bumps promised here we are buy her cup with lid and also straw that folds shut so when she inevitably drops it or knocks it over it ca spill have three and that all used for months because nursing made me so thirsty all the time even once weaned tried to keep up my water intake to help lose some weight it practical does take up much room and can be used well after baby is baby ca recommend enough taking some time to read birth stories either on babybumps podcasts etc most of them are clearly marked if it was traumatic so she can avoid those and sticks to more run of the mill ones it was beyond helpful for me because in the hospital nothing surprised me knew to expect it would take an hour to get my epidural so requested it little before felt reached my limit also if she trying not to use drugs something heard on podcast was that woman had her husband time her contractions and once they saw she ran about 45 second each he was able to tell her at 20 30 second later she was halfway done and it was nearing the end so she could keep focused 45 seconds certainly feels like forever but ten more seconds was something she could mentally handle bottom line there are no bad choices whatever she wants for herself is good choice the most important thing to my mind is having someone in the room who knows her preferences and will make sure the medical staff honors them as much as possible if she too tired or focused to speak for herself for me the worst was the first two weeks after the birth my body was doing all sorts of weird things and we were all adjusting to extreme sleep deprivation making sure she is stocked up on frozen meals and anything she can eat one handed would be huge help giant water bottle with straw is good too also doing all the non baby related chores is immensely helpful take out the trash do dishes do laundry vacuum dust whatever needs to be done after you give birth your lady parts are going to be sore and bit swollen more so if she tears bit get some newborn diapers fill them with water and put them in the freezer laying open like feminine pad when you get home put one in your panties for few minutes and it helps lot with hemoroids swelling and general discomfort throw away when done they are the best thing learn and great way to help with pain management when you do want to take meds because you re nursing same here despite my daughter being little bigger at pounds oz found the actual birth to be breeze labour was another story quick easy no stitches no pain and very little bleeding for day or two after the first few days felt completely normal did however see lot of mums struggling in the post partum ward and all the nurses remarked on my easy recovery so realised was lucky ca decide between hemorrhoids the gigantic bruise on my thighs or the pee burning on my stitches oh no wait the worst of it all was after seven days when everything started to itch like crazy those padcicles were godsend labor was as bad as thought it would be though do birthing class or something in person thought was so smart taking the online one worst decision ever was struggling during labor wanted to go all natural and luckily the labor coach lady who would have had the class with if was so stupid was walking by and noticed how much pain was in she came in and helped me through it teaching me how to breathe focus on one point etc was so grateful she came in but was so mad at myself for not just taking the classes in person wish was told that the time between contractions was actually counted from the start of one contraction to the next so really did have or minutes to recover between contractions it was more like 10 seconds from transition mostly remember sobbing and puking at the same time lol survived with rubber gloves diaper cream scented candle and patience but the hospital had industrial style to and no peribottle frightening stuff made these http www sweetamandine com 2013 03 long live oatcake html m=1 added chia seeds too and froze them along with these http www thekitchn com recipe museli cookies recipes from the kitchn 201475 added seeds and nuts worked out great and they lasted quite awhile my husband and found that watching this series on birth https youtu be j7yucfjuziu video of by very entertaining canadian midwife holliday tyson helped us understand what to expect without being frightening or preachy for me it was really helpful to hear the this is what normally happens and here are the most common complications so knew what could happen but was freaked out it was also nice to hear what issues were relevant to me normal weight and very active so was low risk for the stuff they could predict so my doctor really stressed that because it was my first there were lot of unknowns but she could tell me what other women in my condition had happen bring over food and offer to watch baby so she can nap or shower or both there are lot of good ideas on here but this one regularly like if you can plan on doing this at least weekly for the first year or so she will love you forever wendy is crucial after 12 hours of failed induction slammed double baconator which gave me so much energy for real labor haha this especially number one the biggest fear is your baby could die while you sleep if woke up to use the bathroom in middle of night or if anything woke me up would check on the kids before crawling into bed if could see or hear them breathing had to put my hand in front of their face to feel them breath even when it meant going upstairs when they were older we at least have monitor with video and temperature thing on it so glad hubs chose to get it worth every penny would have loved an actual thing that goes on them cause that was the biggest fear until they turned one do even think about now that they are two definitely nursing pads and will honestly say used tissues with lot of lanolin on between breast and breast pad because it did stick to it as much as the pad but pad was still better than the bra against it if she is planning to breastfeed she will most likely need support because it can be extremely hard for some people let her know you are there for whatever she chooses and that what matters is the baby is healthy either way had couple fb groups that had women from around the world and it made me realize that two is actually more normal age to wean which makes me realize more why handful of two year olds know still have pacifiers so actually nursed my guys till week or two over 2yrs old was very glad nursed that long especially cause had to pump after they nursed for the first 10 months but was so happy that they were done when we stopped nursing will drain her personally very rarely drink anything but water but did enjoy smoothies while nursing because it hey helped fill me up did get anything for myself nor want anything just like having my pictures and videos of them so would say if she does take pictures make sure someone does even if they are no professional pics taken just having the memories is nice especially if you sneak few of her with baby now for me my guys made me dislike lot of sweets plus do like chocolate to begin with but if she is nursing she will definitely need quick food and lot of water watched the whole series of mash on netflix and do know what all else watched just knew that they did like their milk but they were super attached was very glad because sometimes it would annoy me because they would scratch me or be pushing me or try pushing their brother and when they were nursing me would not stop biting one thing wish had gotten was really nice hospital picture of me and my baby got pictures of other people but there are none of me birth class told me contractions would be for about minute several minutes apart then minutes apart then minutes apart they did not tell me might have multiple minute contractions and less than minute to recover between for hours they told me it would hurt when the nurses massage your stomach to help deliver the placenta nobody told me just how much it will hurt if you are not delivering the placenta and the hospital staff is starting to worry about hemorrhage however after the birth felt fine other than tired was up and walking around the building to get my own food couple hours later it did take weeks to have enough energy to go on nice long walk **the best piece of advice received immediately after childbirth the only people who matter are you your baby and your partner ** taking care of the three of you making sure you are all fed and rested will take all of your energy forget the outside world you do need to post to facebook or answer emails if you have question you can text someone to answer it but you are not obligated to do anything for anyone outside of your little family second the tens machine freaking loved that thing
